FDMS 1.0.definition: Code that identifies an exposure unit used.
FDMS 1.0.name: Exposure Unit Type Code

FDMS 1.0.definition: Code that indicates CR image reading density. Defined values are as follows. K0: 5 lines/mm K1: 6.7 lines/mm K2: 10 lines/mm K3: 2.5 lines/mm K4: 20 lines/mm
FDMS 1.0.name: Line Density Code

FDMS 1.0.definition: Identifies whether added exposure or re-exposure. “NORMAL”: Normal/“ADD”: Added exposure/“AGAIN”: Re-exposure
FDMS 1.0.name: >Exposure Kind

FDMS 1.0.definition: Pre-set parameters used for CR image output format and image processing. Either “A” or “B” format is available. A0: For previous models. Single for the 8” ́10” format. LR for others. 1: Single 2: L/R B0:Parameters for the left-side image are used. 1: Parameters for ht right-side image are used. Other : Parameters for the left-side image are used.
FDMS 1.0.name: Film Output Format

FDMS 1.0.definition: Film annotation character string 2.
FDMS 1.0.name: Film Annotation Character String 2

FDMS 1.0.definition: Reference position for starting image reading process on an IP when it is read by an Image Reader. 00: Right top reference 01: Center top reference 02: Center reference 03: Bottom center reference
FDMS 1.0.name: Reading Position Specification

FDMS 1.0.definition: Information that indicates whether image processing parameters have been modified or not. First byte:Left-side image parameter Second byte :Right-side image parameter
FDMS 1.0.name: Image Processing Modification Flag

FDMS 1.0.definition: FNC parameters to be determined as character strings in order of FNL (A to Z), FRB (A to Z), FRT (A to Z) and FRE (0.0 to 1.0). Example: ABC0.7 When FNC is applied (when FNC is ON according to the processing information flag), this tag will be required. When FNC is OFF, this tag will not be output.
FDMS 1.0.name: FNC Parameters

FDMS 1.0.definition: Indicates what type of function processing was performed on an image.
FDMS 1.0.name: Image Processing Type

FDMS 1.0.definition: Image magnification/reduction ratio applied when an image is generated.
FDMS 1.0.name: Mag./Reduc. Ratio

FDMS 1.0.definition: Image generator-specific information.
FDMS 1.0.name: Equipment Type-Specific Information

FDMS 1.0.definition: Specifies an image display position within an area assigned for an image. The default value determined for each device prevails when no such information is set up. 00: Default position 01: Right-justified position 02: Left-justified position
FDMS 1.0.name: Image Position Specifying Flag

FDMS 1.0.definition: Identifies exposure status. “NORMAL”: Normal/“MIS”: Mis-exposure
FDMS 1.0.name: >Exposure Status

FDMS 1.0.definition: Patient ID information version number.
FDMS 1.0.name: Patient Information Version No.

FDMS 1.0.definition: Host name of the image control unit (archiver).
FDMS 1.0.name: Image Control Unit

FDMS 1.0.definition: Information that indicates a position where image data starts and to which direction the image data is scanned, assuming to be a reference a scanning direction where an image is scanned from top right to the left, when an exposed image is seen as a non-reverse image. This four-byte information has the following formats. First byte: 180° image rotation Second byte : Right-and-left image reversal in the main scanning direction Third byte: 90° image rotation Fourth byte: Space
FDMS 1.0.name: Image Scanning Direction

FDMS 1.0.definition: Image reading size.
FDMS 1.0.name: Extended Reading Size Value

FDMS 1.0.definition: Information available when an operation is performed between images.
FDMS 1.0.name: Pair Processing Information

FDMS 1.0.definition: Code used to determine a destination for image distribution.
FDMS 1.0.name: Distribution Code

FDMS 1.0.definition: Film annotation character string 1.
FDMS 1.0.name: Film Annotation Character String 1

FDMS 1.0.definition: Code that indicates EDR mode. Defined values: 0: AUTO MODE 1: SEMI AUTO MODE 2: FIX MODE 3: MANUAL (AUTO) MODE 4: MANUAL (SEMI AUTO) MODE 5: MANUAL (FIX) MODE Numbers from 6 thereafter are reserved for SEMI-XMODE.
FDMS 1.0.name: EDR Mode

FDMS 1.0.definition: Controls the sensitivity center when reading an IP on an Image Reader. 0: Standard sensitivity 1: Semi-high sensitivity 2: High sensitivity
FDMS 1.0.name: Reading Sensitivity Center

FDMS 1.0.definition: ID assigned to each film.
FDMS 1.0.name: Film UID

FDMS 1.0.definition: Kanji exposure menu name.
FDMS 1.0.name: Kanji Menu Name

FDMS 1.0.definition: Code that indicates to what extent an image data piece has been compressed previously. 00: Not compressed. 21: 10-bit data 2/5 lossy compression. 8-bit data 1/2 lossless compression. 22: 1/2 lossless compression. 23: 1/12 lossy compression. 25: New 1/2 lossless compression. 31: 1/20 lossy compression. 41: 1/5 lossy compression.
FDMS 1.0.name: Data Compression Code

FDMS 1.0.definition: Image parameter version number.
FDMS 1.0.name: Image Display Information Version No.

FDMS 1.0.definition: A flag that identifies an image subjected to blackening process. 00: Not subjected to blackening process. 01: Subjected to blackening process.
FDMS 1.0.name: Blackening Process Flag

FDMS 1.0.definition: Sequence that indicates exposure status.
FDMS 1.0.name: Exposure Status Sequence

FDMS 1.0.definition: EDR normalization conditions. Timing correction value for each IP quality type. Set a ×100 value. The range of values is from 0 to 400.
FDMS 1.0.name: Term of Correction for Each IP Type St

FDMS 1.0.definition: A flag that determines contents of the information on image data, which are described in the “ABCD” format. A: Whether LUT correction processing is applied or not. (0=Not applied/1=Already applied, Other=Not applied) B: Whether GPR processing is applied or not. (0=OFF/1=ON1/2=ON2, Other=OFF) C: Whether FNC processing is applied or not. (0=OFF/1=ON, Other=OFF) D: Whether chest wall paint-out processing is applied or not. (0=OFF/1=ON, Other=OFF)
FDMS 1.0.name: Processing Information Flag

FDMS 1.0.definition: ID of an image generated by the Fuji system, consisting of the four characters. For a CR image, the first one character constitutes an ID that identifies each device, and the remaining three characters constitute a serial number for an image generated by a certain device. Numbers from 000 to 999 are used cyclically.
FDMS 1.0.name: FCR Image ID

FDMS 1.0.definition: Kanji hospital name (0008,0080).
FDMS 1.0.name: Kanji Hospital Name

FDMS 1.0.definition: Parameters to be used by new energy subtraction processing. These parameters are indispensable for images generated by new energy subtraction processing and for original images that will be subjected to new energy subtraction processing. For the former, the images imply to have been subjected to processing using these parameters, and for the latter, the images imply that they are to be subjected to processing using these parameters.
FDMS 1.0.name: Energy Subtraction Param. 2

FDMS 1.0.definition: Indicates the result of image positioning by energy subtraction processing. 0: OK 1: NG
FDMS 1.0.name: Subtraction Registration Result

FDMS 1.0.definition: The number of frames exposed on one IP. When there is no such element, handle it to be one frame.
FDMS 1.0.name: No. of Split Exposure Frames

FDMS 1.0.definition: EDR normalization conditions. Dynamic range to be read as image signals out of X rays that have been recorded. Set a ×100 value. The range of values is from 100 to 1500.
FDMS 1.0.name: Reading Gain Gp

FDMS 1.0.definition: The four coefficient table types, Ta, Tb, Tc and Td, used for energy subtraction processing. Each parameter is represented by one character from A to T. Characters other than A to T are illegal. Note that each parameter is represented by one byte, four bytes in totality.
FDMS 1.0.name: Energy Subtraction Param.

FDMS 1.0.definition: Code that identifies a radiographer.
FDMS 1.0.name: Radiographer’s Code

FDMS 1.0.definition: Original image UID that is changed when an image is subjected to correction.
FDMS 1.0.name: Route Image UID

FDMS 1.0.definition: EDR normalization conditions. A relative light emission amount when 2.00 is presumed to be an IP light emission amount, with no object for exposures at 80KVP0.5mR. Set a ×100 value. The range of values is from 0 to 600.
FDMS 1.0.name: Relative Light Emission Amount Sk

FDMS 1.0.definition: A number that identifies function processing in the FCR system. Note, however, that the available range is from “1” to “ZZ”.
FDMS 1.0.name: Set No.

FDMS 1.0.definition: The parameter that controls the afin conversion coefficient information for the purpose of image positioning during new energy subtraction processing. This parameter is stored to be VM=4 and is indispensable for images generated by new energy subtraction processing and for original images that will be subjected to new energy subtraction processing. For the former, the images imply to have been subjected to processing using this parameter, and for the latter, the images imply that they are to be subjected to processing using this parameter.
FDMS 1.0.name: Afin Conversion Coefficient

FDMS 1.0.definition: Kanji requesting department.
FDMS 1.0.name: Kanji Department Name

FDMS 1.0.definition: Fuji’s specific number that identifies an image uniquely.
FDMS 1.0.name: Image UID

FDMS 1.0.definition: Serial numbers from “01” to “99” within the set number (0021,xx30).
FDMS 1.0.name: Image No. in the Set

FDMS 1.0.definition: Kanji body part to be exposed for study. Convert it from the body part menu code and set accordingly.
FDMS 1.0.name: Kanji Body Part for Exposure

FDMS 1.0.definition: Split exposure formats. Defined values: 0: Front 1: Right-and-left two divisions 2: Top-and-bottom two divisions 3: Three divisions 4: Four divisions
FDMS 1.0.name: Split Exposure Format
